page.title: 03BIRD SANCTUARY
page.content: THE BIRD SANCTUARY IS OWNED BY BREAN DOWN FARM.IT WAS OPENED IN 1971 AND WAS ONLY A SMALL BUILDING WHICH HOUSED A FEW BIRDS WHICH STOPPED WHILE MIGRATING NORTH AND SOUTH.SLOWLY BUILDINGS WERE ADDED AND IT NOW HOUSES,ALL KINDS OF TROPICAL BIRDS,RABBITS GOSLINGS,GEESE AND FISH AND INCLUEDS A BREEDING BLOCK. IT IS RUN BY MR.PAYNE WHO HAS IMPROVED IT'S PROTENTIAL.THERE IS NOW A SMALL SOUVENIR SHOP,TEA ROOMS AND PICNIC AREA WHERE FAMILIES CAN SIT.THE SANCTUARY IS WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF BREAN DOWN BUS TURMANAL.IT IS ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT TOURIST ATTRACTIONS AT BREAN, THOUSANDS OF TOURISTS VISIT EACH YEAR. WITHIN THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE IT WILL BECOME AN INCREASINGLY IMPORTANT TOURIST ATTRACTION WITHIN THE BURNHAM, BERROW AND BREAN AREA.THERE IS A LARGE ASSORTMENT OF BIRDS THAT CAN BE VEIWED HERE FROM PARROTS TO BUDGERIGARS.
